title: Grallina
text:
Grallina is a genus of <a href="passerine">passerine</a> <a href="bird">bird</a> native to Australia and <a href="New%20Guinea">New Guinea</a>. It is a member of a group of birds termed <a href="monarch%20flycatcher">monarch flycatcher</a>s.
Taxonomy.
Higher taxonomy.
Long thought to be a member of the mudnest builder family <a href="Corcoracidae">Corcoracidae</a>, the magpie-lark and torrent lark have been reclassified in the family Monarchidae (the monarch flycatchers). The two make up a lineage that split off early from other monarchs and has no close relatives within the family.
The monarch flycatchers are considered either as a subfamily Monarchinae, together with the <a href="fantail">fantail</a>s as part of the drongo family <a href="Dicruridae">Dicruridae</a>, or as a family Monarchidae in its own right. More broadly, they belong to the <a href="Corvida">Corvida</a> <a href="parvorder">parvorder</a> comprising many tropical and Australian passerines including <a href="Pardalotidae">pardalotes</a>, <a href="Maluridae">fairy-wrens</a> and <a href="Meliphagidae">honeyeaters</a> as well as <a href="crow">crow</a>s.
Species.
Two <a href="species">species</a> are recognized:
